riddles.setup: You meet two people at a fork. One always tells the truth, one always lies. You can ask ONE question to find the right path.
riddles.question: What question do you ask?
riddles.answer: Ask either: 'If I asked the other person which path is correct, what would they say?' Then take the opposite path.
riddles.explanation: Both liars and truth-tellers will point to the wrong path with this question. The liar lies about what the truth-teller would say. The truth-teller truthfully reports the liar's lie.
